pageContext.claim: “Under the last administration, drug prices skyrocketed more than 50%. They literally skyrocketed.”
pageContext.analysis: We are not sure where Trump is getting this drug price statistic but he Affordable Care Act actually reduced out-of-pocket prescription costs for seniors. The consumer price index for prescription drugs shows not much difference between Trump and Obama's presidency. Drug prices have gone up under Trump, though he often claims that prices have fallen. For a short period of time, prices did somewhat drop. Consumer prices for prescription drugs fell 0.6 percent in 2018. But the trend reversed in 2019, when prices increased 3 percent — the sixth-highest category of growth after smoking products, medical care, energy, shelter and food away from home. GoodRx, an online prescription cost service, found in September 2020 that drug prices are surging faster than any other medical service or good, increasing by 33 percent since 2014.
